comments:
Using the code currently in the tree (taking it as pre-1.2), compile  
examples/bean/files.lst:

java.lang.NullPointerException
	at org.aspectj.weaver.bcel.LazyMethodGen.getSignature(LazyMethodGen.java:1225)
	at org.aspectj.weaver.bcel.BcelClassWeaver$1.compare(BcelClassWeaver.java:676)
	at java.util.Arrays.mergeSort(Arrays.java:1176)
	at java.util.Arrays.sort(Arrays.java:1123)

(I would have thought this would have been caught in a nightly "release" build,
which compiles all the examples.)

Hmm, I would have expected the cruise control tests to pick that up too... will 
have to investigate. Assigning to George Harley initially to figure out why the
test failure was not picked up. Also marking as target 1.2 as we need to resolve 
this before any release.

George, please reassign to Andy or I once you've looked at the cruise control 
portion.

As a fix for defect 50096 I have added a couple of custom Ant tasks to our 
nightly build scripts that will fail the build if (a) a failure is detected in 
the running of the JUnit tests or (b) a failure is detected in the running of 
the other harness tests. These tasks were only introduced to our build machine 
today (23 Feb) and I would expect them to catch this sort of error.

The actual bug here appears to be the same as bug #51919 to do with cases 
where multiple methods are ITD'd that have the same name but differ in terms 
of parameter signatures.  Looking at BoundPoint in the bean example, it 
contains ITDs that have exactly this characteristic.

51919 is now fixed and with the latest version of AspectJ from CVS, I can 
compile with examples/bean/files.lst.
fixed by both Andy Clement and George Harley.
updating target flag to indicate inclusion in 1.2 release.
